Visionaries are characterized by extreme passion for their product, service, company, and customers.
Visionaries are typically entrepreneurs, creators, and founders who often hold titles like CEO or President.
Internal roles like Visionary or Integrator create more clarity than traditional corporate titles.
Visionaries generate approximately ten new ideas per week, with a few brilliant ones driving organizational growth.
Visionaries are invaluable for their ability to produce game-changing ideas that can take companies to extraordinary heights.
Visionaries excel at solving big problems and devising creative solutions, not practical day-to-day issues.
Visionaries are continuous learners who enjoy discovering new ideas and applying them to benefit their company.

Visionaries thrive on discovering new ideas and learning how to apply them innovatively.
Effective teaching often happens visually, using whatever tools are at hand to diagram concepts.
Innovation starts by noticing disharmonies that common sense overlooks or denies.

Visionaries drive R&D, focusing on future market needs and strategic connections.
Creating a compelling company vision requires seeing opportunities others can't.
Bold moves during crises, like not downsizing, can lead to massive growth and competitive advantage.
